Karthikeyan D wrote:

> Yes Jason is correct . One time set up is what I'm looking for. But
> TestSetup will not solve my problem. As it is explained , it will do
> the setup and teardown once for the TestSuite . But my requirement is
> ontime setup for each TestCase (which will have more than one
> testmethod) . So the way around what i can think now is , I can make
> individual test as testSuite and implement this.And consodilating these
> suites into a master TestSuite.
> I there any issues with this approach.

Be careful.

Each test is an instance of TestCase that executes a test method.

JUnit automatically builds a TestSuite for each TestCase class by 
collecting all the test methods.

Try TestSetup. It will do what you seem to want it to do:

invoke TestSetup.setUp
invoke TestCase.test1
invoke TestCase.test2
...
invoke TestCase.testn
invoke TestSetup.tearDown
